reviewText: This gate is going to get the job done however it is a little hard to open and close.  Other then that it is great.

I'm a dog person.  I don't like cats and although my daughter is too little to care (this holds her daycare bottles for the insulation), I wasn't thrilled with the cat choice.  But the colors were right, so that's the one I chose.Let me say, it's so much cuter in person.  It's cute online, but in person it just pops.  Maybe that's true for all the choices.  Just love it.  Got it an ordered the backpack in the cat too, because I couldn't resist.  Won't go on my daughter's back, but will hold her diapers and change of clothes etc that I need to drop off at daycare.

Was hoping this would help secure my daughters toys to her high chair and stroller. It works alright if she doesn't tug or pull at it much - which she does all the time. It also isn't very long, so I usually clip the two together to make it longer. I attached it to her stroller over the weekend while we were out and she had managed to detach it so her toy got dragged around.

These blankets are so versatile and they are the perfect size - so much better than the tiny flannel receiving blankets that newborns outgrow so quickly.  They have gone from newborn swaddling blankets (the best blankets for swaddling!) to car seat covers, stroller covers, and now I put them in cribs for naps and overnight use.  Some moms use them as breastfeeding cover-ups too.  I recommend buying a pack of four as they will be in frequent use.I love the variety of prints and and they hold up very well to cold-water wash/normal dry laundry cycles.  I have not seen any fading or fraying after 10 months of heavy use.Interesting note - the aden + anais blankets I have ordered from Amazon are of a different quality than the ones you see at Target or other department/clothing stores.  They are slightly thicker with  more texture.  Not necessarily better or worse, just different.aden + anais blankets are my "go-to" baby shower gift.  These should come standard with every baby!

I ordered the giraffe one for my older child to give to the new baby.  It's super soft and not as heavy as some of similar lovies I have seen in stores (my son sleeps with his over his face, so I was looking for something lighter).  I've washed it and it washed great.My mom made something similar to this for my older child and we learned a valuable lesson...never ever get let your child get attached to something that there is only one of in the entire world (his was made from fabric scraps and the fabric was discontinued).Now I'm going to order at least 2 more--one for daycare and a backup.  We have had more than one rough night where a beloved security item has been lost or soiled and was rendered unavailable.

this is a must...we have the eddie bauer system with car seat and stroller, and our suv has leather seats so great for the protection and as well as it has the pockets in the front to store stuff, but its a little short.
This idea is so great.  It helps contain the mess left on restrauant floors. Plus you can recycle the food!
This set is for my 15 month old. They did fine in the dishwashers silverware tray & they are not blunt for each type of utensil. This mommy is pleased:)

I have this on my 2011 bob revo single for my almost 4 year old- fits like a gem!  Very sturdy, no wobbling.  Nice and high/wide wheels so i can walk under the board w/o interfearing much with my walking (had this problem when i tried the mutsy board so i had to return it).  you can even fold the bob with it on, it's just a big bigger of course.  Very smooth ride- can go up/down curbs too, no problems.  My kids love this thing and i was ready to be done with a double bob as it was really big indoors.  I would not get a board for your kid until they are 3 as it takes some maturity.  My 2 year old does love to hope on too though for quick rides too!  Great buy even if it's pricey :  Saves my sanity as my almost 4 year old gets very whiny and tired when we are out!!!
my kid is not two yet, but he likes playing with these letters, l like that they stick to the tub, they are big and colorfull.
summary: i like it more than my kid!

reviewText: The whole point was the magnet on the scoop.  The magnet is too weak to work properly because the first wash cycle on the washer, the scoop falls off and is MIA until you can figure out where it fell.  The scoop itself is fine but again, the whole point of this scoop for me was that it stuck to the washer/dryer.  Oh we'll.

The first restaurant I tried to take this to, it didn't work, because the table had wood grain which affected the ability to stick.  This is best for fast-food type table tops, granite, or very heavily sealed wood grain.
Nice bumpers. Soft and good size. Tall to keep baby's arms and legs out of the bars and keep things from falling out. Not too thick for the warm AZ summer nights.
summary: Nice bumpers. Soft and good size

reviewText: This fits the average playpen. I needed this for my parents house, for the baby to sleep on. This mattress is so thin and lightweight yet soft and enough padding for my little one to sleep on!
summary: Must have if your playpen is used for sleeping!

reviewText: Read overall good reviews. Suctioned to wall on day one. It fell on day 1,2 and 3. But stayed up after that. It's been a week without falling. It's packed full of toys and hasn't moved. I think its worth it.
summary: suction worked after a few times

reviewText: The cover is soft and it's nice to have the separate waterproof pad, but the color is atrocious!  I purchased the yellow to go with my baby's yellow room, but it's not yellow at all.  It looks like the color of cornmeal, a real ugly boring color!
These are way better than those bulky plugs my son tried to take these out but he couldn't. I totally approve of these.
Love these! Very soft& wash well. Only minus is they can be slightly small. I wish they were a tad bigger at times like other natural pads.

I found this to be a great toy to be a first to let my son hold on his own.... i could help him get a grip on the tail part and i could let him chew on it and flail it around because its soft so i didn't have to worry about him hurting himself as we all know the first thing they do is start hitting themselves in the face with whatever they get a grip on!
summary: a great first toy! Soft so doesn't hurt when baby hits self in the face!

reviewText: works great and fits in the kitchen perfectly. only thing is that it doesn't really drain, the water kinda sits there.

I ordered this backpack yesterday, it was $18.99 I see that today it is $15, not a big deal but grrrrrr I hate it when that happens! The backpack was delivered in less then a day! I checked it out to make sure I did not get a fake as that seems to be happening. So I made sure I ordered from a Amazon fulfillment center. I could have picked one from the hop skip website, it $20 but I needed (wanted it) by our next outing in a few days.My child is 15 months old and spends short amount of time (1.5hrs a week) at a gym daycare, and we go out shopping, story time etc and I did not need the whole fully stocked diaper bag. what was happening was leave the diaper bag in the car and hope we didn't need a change, then I started keeping a diaper, wipes and some snack pouches in my purse, this got old fast and I needed to leave those items with my kid and didn't want to leave my purse so after looking at solutions I decided this was the cutest backpack ever and my daughter can have it with us, it is not big and bulky like a diaper bag, but better then using my purse!As soon as it arrived I emptied all the baby stuff out of my purse/bag the backpack will hold diapers, wipes, a jacket, and more! I was concerned about it being too small as some people pointed out, but since we have 1.5 years before pre-school I thought it was worth the cost if we used it 3 times a week for a year+ and if it lasts into pre-school even better! I have a feeling that I will mostly be carrying the bag for her, My daughter wore it for a little while, the straps are very adjustable, they will fit a small toddler all the way to an adult.It says it comes with a snack pouch, I was a little disappointed to learn that the snack pack is just the front pocket. They should have called it a insulated snack pocket. Snack pouch sounded to me like something we could remove from the backpack, fill with snacks. But there is a matching lunch bag that I will get if we need meals on the go regularly. Right now this backpack is perfect for our needs. I am so happy I don't have to keep my kids stuff in my bag anymore. This is so much easier to carry. I will still keep the fully stocked diaper bag in the car (because what else am I going to do with it) it has the emergency supplies, sunblock, teething gel, tylenol.
summary: super cute, just what we needed for toddler

reviewText: The pictures make it look like it stays open easily so that the child can get things in and out of it.  It doesn't actually work that way.  It's kind of flimsy and hard for him to get things in and out of.

I got these appliques for my 2 year old, but I think he would have loved them at any age. Right now he likes to stick them on the wall of the tub (when wet they stick to smooth surfaces almost like stickers) and also like them up on the edge of the tub (the edges are thick enough that they can stand). I love that they are soft so there is no worry about damaging the tub when he tosses them and the material does not absorb water so there is less chance of mold or mildew growing. I read other reviews about pieces being chewed off, but they seem to be pretty tough and a child with enough teeth to do any damage (ie not a baby) can be told not to chew on certain toys.
we used this product a lot. it is a great product for a newborn....the only thing is if you have a gasy baby or a bottle that need to feed with less air i recommend brown's baby bottle
Love this rack.  It is way easier to clean than the lawn.  Like the heavy duty plastic and cup for small loose parts.I like the OXO bottle brush as well.

I bought this to put on the rear windshield of my car to shield the baby when rear-facing.  I thought the picture showed a rear-facing attachment.  After I got it it states not to be used on front or back windshields.  I have a Mustang and the side windows are way too small to attach.  Also, I figured I'd attach to the rear window anyway since there were 2 and it wouldn't affect my view but it doesn't stick.  There are no clips attached.  I'm not giving up yet and I'm sure there must be a way but for now I'm disappointed.  Otherwise, for the price the quality is acceptable and it is nice to have 2.  Just be sure you know that it is not designed for rear window use.

We purchased these for our 3 month old. It's a great utilitarian purchase because we find we need a new bib after every feeding.  It comes of many different colors, and comprises of terry cloth.  However, our baby's spit up quickly gets absorbed through to reach his clothing and allow it to get wet as well.  This to us is an issue; it would be better if it had a liner.
The sound voice can adjusted, and the music is pleasant to baby, it is useful when baby is crying ii.

This toy looks much better than it is. The product description reads like it is more than it is. I was disappointed for a few reasons. First, the magnets are so weak. They can hardly stay on. Also, the two sides of the pieces are the same with opposite polarity. I wish they had different designs so kids can learn about the two effects of magnetism.The bear's head is cute, but it is quite small and is easily lost.A great idea over the usual ring post toy, but this design needs some improvements.
summary: Not Attracted to This Magnetic Toy

reviewText: I love it. Looks nice and my baby sits comfortable in it. But I give it a 4-star because its' stand is not easy to wipe clean. General it's a great one for the price.

We bought both this aspirator and the nose Frida at the same time.After using both for several weeks, I like this one better for the main reason that the tip is rubber instead of plastic and seems to be much easier on my young infant's nose.
summary: I like it better than nose Frida

reviewText: THE GOOD:**Cute - Nice color and I love seeing my little one in it. :)**Ease of portability - Extremely lightweight yet really sturdy. It's easy to pick up and move around to places like on the big couch in lvg rm, bed, floor opposite kitchen, etc.) EVEN while he's in it. Love that I can do my chores while he hangs out with me.**Thumbs up for Arc of hanging toys - When I first bought this, I would just leave the arc of hanging toys off because my baby wasn't old enough to appreciate them. Now that he's 9 weeks he really seems to be enjoying the toys!**Baby enjoys being in it - My son loves this bouncer. He watches me from it but most of the time he just sits quietly in it, checking out the "scenery". He likes to kick his feet, smile, and "talk" to me from it as well! :)**Hands-free care - Also found I can "bounce" his bouncer with my foot by gently nudging the frame up and down while I do computer work or check emails, etc. Invaluable for getting stuff done WHILE he's awake.THE BAD:**Hanging Arc of toys is NOT a handle - I was a little frustrated about this at first but then I realized you could pick up the bouncer from the metal base. The arc is really just for toys and nothing else. IMO, this issue is hardly consequential as this product gives such great value for the money.OVERALL:Awesome buy. You might be tempted but try not to leave your baby in this for too long!! LoL
summary: Invaluable and a great price too!

reviewText: In case you were wondering which swing to get your LO, I'm making the declaration here and now, for all to see: Fisher Price.I've tried the Carters (never fit right), the Mamaroo (good for staying asleep but not getting to sleep), and the Fisher Price, and Fisher Price is hands down MAGICAL.It takes a crying baby and makes it into a sleeping baby.It plugs into the wall.Its cushy and cozy and makes mama and baby extraordinarily happy.Do it to it, folks.

The high contrast design fascinates her. Beyond that I do not recommend this product. It didn't fit her at three months old. They where not shaped for the feet so they fit awkwardly. They did not rattle loudly either.
It is a simply, fun toy for my baby to play when he is in the water. I bought another one for my friend!

We now have 2 of these seats.  I heard a lot about this chair on a forum I was part of.  I looked more into it and was very impressed myself.1) I like the slimmer design that seems to be accomplished by using steel instead of plastic.  This makes it heavier but I don't carry the seat around so I don't mind.2) IF you travel and need to take the car seat, the bottom folds up to make it flat.  This makes it easier to take onto planes and travel with.3) There are various openings in the seat where the fabric has velcro to hold it together.  This is so that you can easily gain access to the back of the seat to thread things through (the LATCH system is connected and needs to be thread through, if you use a seat belt, it needs to be threaded through, this makes it easier to do so).4) It has low sides.  For me, this is a plus.  I don't have to lift my children up high to get them in the seat (which in the past lead me to bump heads on the roof).  It also seems to make it easier for our oldest (3yrs) to get in and out of the seat on his own.5) The flap in the front has a pocket for storing emergency contact information.  It may seem a tad "weird" but it makes sense.  You can fill out the information and in the event of a bad accident, someone can use this information if you are unable to communicate.6) Did I mention they're slim?  I have a Toyota Rav4 and have 2 of these in the back and can still fit a grown adult in the back seat.  I have one seat attached via seat belt and the other using the LATCH.  Please keep in mind that in 2014 the rules for using the LATCH system is changing officially.  You should not use it if the combined weight of car seat and child is 65lbs or more.  This seat weighs in at 24lbs.  This means you should stop using the LATCH system when your child weighs 41lbs.  Our oldest was only 1 or 2 lbs shy when I was installing the new seat so I just went ahead and switched it ahead of time.7) The cup holder does not snap in but is stable for holding a cup.  It's just easy for the child in the seat to remove it.That's all I can think of for now!
summary: Best car seat we have owned

reviewText: this is such a great buy. it is super light, makes it easy to change sheets, and it's water-proof so all it takes is a wipe. i bought it for my toddler son's firetruck toddler bed. it fits perfectly without any problems.
summary: super light and easy to clean

reviewText: The "natural" color version of these diapers shed terribly after the first wash.  The pills just don't seem to go away even after repeated washes.  I don't even want to use them as burp cloths.

I agree with the previous reviewer, they are square and resemble more wash cloths than burp clothes. I haven't used them yet (delivering in a few weeks) but already washed them.  They lost their nice shape after washing and drying.  I am sure they will be fine for what they need to do, but they are definitely not the best burp clothes on the market.
So much better than dvitosol. My son hated and usually spit up the massive amount of fluid suggested for the dvitosol. With this its just one drop and your good.

Fits the accompanying changing pad well and is really soft to the touch. Haven't had it long enough to speak to durability after many wash cycles but it's working well so far. It also has precut holes for the safety strap to go through it (assuming you haven't cut it off like I did)

These fit our Ford Freestyle seats, so we're happy with them. I agree with all of the other reviewers that said the pockets were pointless. My 2.5yr old kicks at them & likes to catch his heel in them. I'm tempted to cut them off just to remove the temptation for him. We never put anything in them.

We got these primarily because our baby loves to gnaw on the table when out at restaurants... The disposable placemats given at Chick-Fil-A worked great as a barrier for her, so we got these. Ehh, these aren't nearly as good - she manages to yank these off in a matter of seconds vs the other ones staying on for most of our meal.
summary: Baby can peel these off really easily

reviewText: nice mobile- my son only liked it for a few months so I cannot review it for longevity purposes. Nice pictures- they did hold his attention and the advanced ones made him smile. It is simple- no music or movement- but he never seemed to mind (it held his attention as much as the mobile on his swing which does make noise and rotates). My friend has a newborn who stares at it for long periods of time and I passed it down to her. She says he also loves it. Maybe this is best for 0-3 months range. It was worth the money in my opinion.

I really love the cozy, minky fabric of this elephant blanket. The brown is a manly color for my little guy, and doesn't show stains at all. However, the one thing you should be aware of is that the elephant on this is really pretty big, about 10" x 8". Because the stitching on the elephant is less soft than the rest of the blanket, I find myself not wanting to set his head or bare skin against the elephant portion of it, so I wish the elephant was quite a bit smaller. Other than that, this is a fantastic blanket and I would certainly purchase it again for myself or for a friend.
summary: A cozy, soft blanket, but be aware the elephant is huge

reviewText: They were a little long for my seats but I was able to fold them up and tape them in place with black electrical tape. You can't even tell!

I love the look and feel of these spoons, but the round shape is too big for my daughter's small mouth.  Difficult to get her to open so wide to fit it, so I end up making a mess everywhere.  I would suggest using these only when they are able to feed themselves.
summary: Too big for my nine month old

reviewText: Works great for my Medela pump in style tote pump- I bought as a replacement for my original tubing which got milk in it.  This is a great product to replace the original tubing
Should have gone with the firefly. Jacques is hard for my 5 month old to hold. Doesn't stand up too well on its own either.
Keeps my son warm, although is a bit stiff. Feels similar to soft wool. Nice blanket but to fit in baby bag. Really bulky when folded.

I have dr brown reuglar bottles and also have dr brown brush, however I'm sick and tired of the bristle spraying water everywhere everytime I pull it out of the bottle. I don't know why all the bottle brushes comes like that... it's pointless. Inorder to get the milk greese off the bottle, you need a nice sponge brush like this. I highly recommanded.However it require a little wiggle effort to get into the regular bottle. It's alittle big at the opening, but thats the only way it will fill up the bottle when cleaning.
summary: Nice sponge brush without having to deal with bristle

reviewText: We have two of these gates - one spans a wide hallway and the other an uneven kitchen opening. There are plastic parts to this gate, but the gate is well designed and very sturdy - because it's hardware mounted and not pressure mounted, the plastic parts aren't squeezed.The mounting is what sets this gate apart - the mounting pieces can be slid up or down along the end bars and thus do not have to be mounted right at the ground - if you have base boards like us, this eliminates the need to shim or cut into the baseboards to get an even install.We also liked the fact that the gate doesn't have extensions that create uneven openings - the gate will just curve out if it is wider than your opening.The latch mechanism isn't the easiest but can be done with one hand and I don't worry about my 10 month old figuring out how to undo it (she's tried).The hold-open button is a lot more useful than we thought it would be - it's nice to leave the gate open after our child is in bed or if she's in the high chair.
summary: Great gate for wide spaces and homes with baseboards

reviewText: Fit my son's crib perfectly.  It's nice to have the loops to hang toys on.  I guess I expected something a little more "grand" for the price.  It's just a flat lined (although well sewn) sheet with velcro loops.Overall, I'm happy with the purchase.

My daughter who is 6 months old and teething loves these mam pacifiers. She usually tries to chew on her regular pacifiers so I figured these were a great idea. They are a two for one. Two purposes one pacifier. They arrived fast and on time! :)

We've had this now for about two months.  Originally we intended to use a pack and play for cosleeping, but turns out baby didn't like that.  The cosleeper has been great in general though there are a few quirks about it.General Observations: Pro or Con depending on how you look at it.1. Height - so the standard height it comes at seems to work for traditional beds on shorter metal frames.  But for our pillowtop beds, its a few inches short.  You can buy extensions, but I recommend getting regular bed risers.  They're cheaper and we found a set at bed bath that fit the feet of the cosleeper exactly and brought the height right to our pillowtop beds.2. Portability - it does fold up small and everything packs back into the bag.  I'll say though it is a bit heavy for its size and the buttons to initiate the folding are behind fabric sleeves so it's easy to miss them even though the fabric has markings that say push here.  Also you have to do the fold in a special order (bottom first) or it won't work.  Bottom line is practice about two or three times and you'll have it down.Pros:1. Smaller size is great as our rooms aren't that big so it makes it easier to get around it in the middle of the night.2. Storage compartment underneath is awesome can take tons of stuff.  Just make sure you don't put things in there you need to access often.3. Wheels, the wheels on one side make it easy to move around the same floor, but if you're moving it to another level you should fold it or it's a two person job despite the size.  The wheels also lock so no worries about its rolling around on its own.4.Adjustable heights - you can adjust the hight at each of the four corners and we used this to tilt it slightly to help with baby's gas issues.  This might not be a good idea once he can start rolling around on his own.Cons:1. I guess you can't use it that long, but do you really want baby right next to you forever?2. It ain't that good looking, but then neither are you with a baby waking you up constantly.

This thing is fantastic... good lower back support and breathable cotton where baby is!  I know people love the Moby, but I just didn't think too much of it... this thing solved my problems with that.

We really liked these for the first couple months we had them.  Then our daughter, who was about 16 months old at the time, learned that she could pull the straws out with a bit of effort.  Before that, they were great and kept leaks to a minimum.  Now... not so much.  Also, we've had several instances where the cup has dropped from 1-2 feet above the ground and the lid popped off, resulting in the entire cup spilling on the floor.It's time to toss the Take & Toss Straw Cups!
summary: Good until your toddler learns they can pull the straws out...

reviewText: The pads were a bit smaller than I was expecting them to be, however they work great!  I use them to protect my changing tables.  They're too big to be over the shoulder "burp pads", but would probable be great protection during tummy time.

I did a lot of research before I bought this car seat - safety is most important.  I'm VERY VERY satisfied with this car seat.  I don't know how well some of those more expensive($300+) ones works, but this particular ones is very well made for a lot less money. The construct is solid and reasonably heavy, doesn't feel flimsy like a cheaper($60) one I also have.The car seat is very adjustable, degree of recline etc. to make child comfortable sitting in it. The weight is a bit heavier than the cheaper ones, but once installed, one wouldn't be moving it very often anyway.  The seat is well padded, so it's comfortable. The installation is easy, i used it with seat anchor, hook into the anchor, pull the tab on the belt, and it's done! Wife really liked the this one, we ended up bought total 3 of these to install in various cars.

our baby is 13 months and even though it is recomended for earlier age it works great. Of course, it is necessary to be there next to the baby for any bath. it is easy to use and the baby has a lot of freedom to enjoy bathing.  finally I can give her a bath by myself.
I wish my baby was still in his crib because i loved the way this looked. Great design and feel.

My son is 6.5 months old and we've had this since birth. This is our first baby so of course we were terrified of bath time. This definitely helped us feel more confident that we wouldn't accidentally make the water too hot or too cold. I still use it every day. Works great still, never fogged up. My son likes to play with it now, too.

I think this is a really great teether.  Our six month old has no trouble grasping it herself.  This was a problem with some of the other teethers we tried.  Also, some of the other products were too large or oddly shaped and she was unable to get them into her mouth comfortably.  We are satisfied with this item and I am about to place an order for a second one so that we don't get caught without it.Give it a try.
summary: This is the one you want!

reviewText: I chose this mirror because it can securely attach to the car and won't go flying about in the event of an accident. I was hoping I'd be able to see just enough to know what's going on back there. To my surprise, the mirror is CRYSTAL clear, and big enough that I can see the entire seat my child is sitting in. I LOVE IT! I had to break myself of the habit of looking back too much instead of looking forward. ;) Best mirror ever, couldn't recommend enough.

Another great product by Britax. Car seat installs tighter than the older seats. I know that my daughter is completely safe in this seat. The print is my favorite. I would definitely recommend buying this product.Only draw back is it can be tight on babies thighs.

Nothing fancy or special here but they get the job done. If you have little ones and aren't trying to spend a fortune on outlet covers then look no further. They stay put and aren't a nightmare to pull out when you need to plug something in. Most importantly my kids haven't figured out how to get them out (knock on wood).

Do ANYTHING and EVERYTHING you can to avoid VELVET HANGERS! They are the worst thing EVER invented. It's so hard to get clothing on and off those hangers. With baby hangers, and clothing being small and hard to manage to begin with... It's just TOO much HASSLE! With babies you want everything around you to be easy, because babies are very difficult. I would recommend finding a different set without velvet hangers, or perhaps purchasing individually.

I LOVE these nipple wipes.  I'm a second time mom and breastfed my first for 2 years.  Minus a ton of food allergies, I never really had much nipple pain or soreness.  However, this time around, even with a good latch, my nipples have been put through the ringer.  We battled 2 rounds of thrush and a round of mastitis... after all of that, it left me with some nipple trauma, soreness, and the worst part, very dry nipples from all the treatments and vinegar rinses.  I wanted to stay away from the think creams as these can create a barrier and a encourage yeast growth so I purchased these wipes. They have been AMAZING.  Within a few days of using them, I've noticed a dramatic difference in the pain at latch on. A couple of weeks ago, I thought we had thrush again, but started using these to add moisture and see if it was indeed thrush or trauma.  I'm pretty certain it's not thrush again and can thank these nipple wipes for restoring some moisture and comfort! I would have loved to give it 5 stars, but I love organic products that are completely preservative free.  These do contain Polysorbate 20 and Sodium Benzoate, both of which I believe are preservatives, however when compared to the parabens, these are relatively mild. Get these... you will not be sorry!!!!!!

This product is great--just big enough to use as a changing pad anywhere in the house or on the go or to use as a liner under baby on any surface. The fabric is very soft and has already withstood many washes without pilling or deteriorating. Highly recommend.
They dont fit in the first essentials bottle.... they leak. Completely pointless waste of money would not reccomend or buy again, I only use Nuk now
summary: they dont fit in the first essential bottles

reviewText: Worked pretty well for our 18 month old on a trip, but our son easily rolled out. We had put pillows around the bed to make sure he didn't hurt himself. I would imagine that this might have been due to his light weight, but we expected the bed to sink in the middle and hold even a smaller child.

Well done! I like this to keep at the dining room table. Easy to clean up after baby without having a huge eyesore broom out all the time. It has little grooves in the pan to get the crumbs off the brush, but that just makes them fly about. I like that I can just clean it quick with a rinse in the sink. Awesome.

These bottles are easy to use and don't leak!  They are great for breastfed babies as they do not flow super fast and are wider nipples.  They are relatively inexpensive compared to many other bottles.  One of my favorite things about this bottle is that you can take it apart.  Yes, it's more parts to wash but you know the bottom & inside of the bottles are actually clean.  I often wonder if other bottles actually really get cleaned well (especially in the dishwasher).
These were the perfect size for my newborn son, but he is growing out of them. They are adorable as well and very absorbent. For the price and quality, I have been very pleased with them thus far.

I love the Foogo for my son.  It keeps his milk cold ALL day (I add an ice cube), it's easy for him to operate the lid and it's a great size for kids about 14 months through preschool.I don't like the plastic cap on the bottom.  It just glued-on and chips, breaks or falls off with a few toddler tosses or drops. And what toddler doesn't throw or drop their cup?!?This is the same product as the Thermos FunTainer - just different colors/designs, and you can often find the FunTainer cheaper.  (we have 2)Teach your child to close the lid when done - if they don't, it will leak.  Also, check the straw often for holes or tears.  Tots love to chew on the silicone straw and it will need replaced.  It'll leak if the straw has a small hole, and it can be dangerous if a chunk comes off.
summary: Keeps drinks COLD and easy to clean

reviewText: Our six-month-old loves this.  We have it on the b/w side, but he loves to look at the images and pull on the animals.  He began to enjoy it at three months, and it doesn't seem to have gotten old!

This item has been great to use for our newborn as we can put him to sleep in the family room or move him around the house so he can be where we are.  It is better than a bouncer as he is up off the floor and closer to me.  I have also slept on the sofa with him beside me and I have rocked him to sleep.  We do not put him to sleep in it at night, he used his bassinet then.  I would definitely buy again and recommend.  Paranoid about flat head I use a meiji head pillow with the rocker, if you are worried buy one of those too.

My daughter wanted constant holding. Very few times could I set her to play alone the fist 3 months, but I splurged on this one at 2.5 months because the Skip Hop owl puppet was the first toy she showed amusement with, and I was hoping to find some relief. Being able to set her down happy for 10-15 minutes at a time was worth the price. She is almost 6 months old now and still likes it. Plus, Skip Hop's designs are adorable and not too obnoxiously bright.

Finally, a cup holder I can use on the Maclaren Volo, Baby Jogger City Elite, and Combi twin sport. It's able to hold many drinks, BUT it swivels. You can't have a drink that has an opening on top because with one little bump everything will spill.
I had bought this but the caterpillar one and she loved it, so I bought it for her cousin too. He loved it. The babies like the crinkly sound lol
I got this product within the first week of breastfeeding. I thought I needed it but I really didn't. Bottom line- I never used it.
summary: Thought I needed it but I didn't

reviewText: My husband is very picky about music. He loves the music on this toy. It's not annoying and I'm glad it's not the typical baby music. My son loves the sound and lights. It's a great buy for the price!

These diaper covers make the perfect diaper for my daughters smaller dolls. They are quite durable, wipe off easily ( or machine wash), and are just adorable.My daughter simply loves that it something a real live baby would wear. Now as far as a diaper cover for a real baby these would be great. The x-small I think would be for a very small baby because the dolls these go on are Preemie sized.No matter what you need these for real or pretend I recommend them!

I've taken my boppy on my summer road trips and any place in my house where I want to feel comfortable. It's comfy between my knees, on my lap, and behind my back. I'd consider getting a second one to keep on the couch for naps. It's starting to get a little bit of a shallow spot on the neck, but I still love it.
Great, works so well in every situation, nice large claw for quick attachment, a velcro loop, and the arm is great for portable crib.

We bought this seat after our Primo Ducka potty seat finally wore out after nearly two years of use.  This seat looked more durable, comfortable, and was my son's favorite color (aqua blue).The WeePod has a very cushy seat and splash guard that easily wipes clean, though some liquid does go into the cracks underneath the seat.  There is a handle on the back of the seat for hanging when not in use.While our toilet seat is a standard sized round seat, the WeePod has to be tightly wedged on the toilet seat each time, which is a bit difficult for my toddler to do by himself.  The WeePod has an adjustment knob for the rubber "feet" that hold the seat to the toilet, but even on its smallest setting, it still barely fits our toilet.Overall, this is a quality seat and my son likes using it, but I wish the feet were able to be adjusted a bit further.Update (11/29/12): After about 2.5 years of daily use by our boys, the rubber hanging handle finally broke, and some of the seat's rubber is a bit discolored, so we are buying a new Prince Lionheart weePOD (this time, Mommy is choosing poppy pink!). :)
summary: Comfortable but barely fits on a standard toilet seat!

reviewText: I was hesitant in getting this pillow because of the price tag and simply because women have survived pregnancies without it. But at 25 weeks, I was getting really uncomfortable at night so I decided I'd try anything to help me get me more sleep.  I'd definitely recommend it, it's nice using one pillow instead of 4. I'm a back sleeper, so this helps keep me on my side and the part that goes behind your head is nice because it keeps the acid reflux down. The pillow case is not bad taking off, kind of a pain to slide back on. I don't think it's too soft. I like my pillow on the firm side and it's fine. (I'm about 5'2" and 130 lbs (30 weeks), pre-pregnancy weight was 110).

I just washed these pacifiers. Soap gets into the part that goes into your baby's mouth through a tiny hole. Then once it is in there, the soap escapes as little soap bubbles into your baby's mouth. We tossed ours immediately. We don't want baby swallowing soap!!
summary: Don't put this in your baby's mouth after you wash it!!

reviewText: This is a lovely and soft blanket.  Also cute baby blanket.  I would buy more if they had it in other colors.  For the price you cannot lose with this purchase.  Very happy with this buy

I was honestly starting to get concerned. Our two year old was upset not to have a binky any more and he was putting not-so-great things in his mouth. With a sibling on the way I suspected we'd face binky wars if we didn't figure something out. We got it, it looked good, but would he bite?We presented it as a special, new big boy chewy. We didn't give it to him to pacify him. It didn't become an all-day sucker. We showed him where it was kept and told him he could have it whenever he wanted it. He made the connection that the pacifier was for babies and also hard to get. But he could easily get the chewy and work out his chewing mood when he needed to. When we found him mouthing books or toys we re-directed him to the chewy. He even sometimes asks for his chewy.Mouthing objects, chewing books and sampling paper have all now greatly diminished, in part, I guess because of his chewy. It's sturdy, well-made and I don't have concerns about safety. We have had the original pair for over a year and they have held up perfectly. He doesn't use the chewy every day but it does satisfy his desire to chew.

I love the Playtex Nurser bottles! I love that you don't have so many pieces per bottle to wash like the Ventaire bottles. You only need to wash/sterilize the nipples, caps, and rings, which saves a new mom lots of time. The wide nipples do make it a little hard for the baby to latch on at first but they get used to it. I also like the drop ins because I know they are presterilized so I don't worry about the germs for my baby. The fact that the bags help reduce the air the baby intakes is also a bonus. This set is a great starter kit- it came with two sizes of bottles, the 4 oz for now and the 8 oz for when baby can drink larger amounts and also drop in liners.The only reason I gave this 4 stars is because the set only gives you 2 of each bottle size and if you are like me and like to premake a few bottles for convenience, you'll have to buy an additional set to get extra bottles. Also, the drop in liners do have one flaw - the ounce measurements on them are not colored so they blend in and are hard to see; I discovered that they are also inaccurate and are off by 1/2 ounce. I use a Ventaire bottle to measure out her formula and to measure what she didn't drink.Overall these are great bottles and are very convenient.

I got this sheet in two colours for my daughter. They are of very thin material though very soft. My daughter's a toddler so, as other parents would know, I am constantly having to change her crib sheets. The price for these was pretty good so I don't mind the thinness. I use the American Baby Organic Quilted mattress cover underneath so there's a layer of softness underneath, and this combo is perfect for summer and warm spring/autumn. The sheet is not luxurious by any stretch of the imagination, but the mattress cover is. (That's another review though!). I recommend these sheets if you're looking for an inexpensive but decent sheet or collection of sheets for your child's crib. With the low price, you can get them in different colours to have on hand for those midnight changes...Or any other time your child throws up or pees in bed, or you spill something onto their sheet!
summary: It's an okay sheet for summer.

reviewText: This mobile is very cute.  It plays the typical mobile songs.  The hot air balloons are a little wonky, though - just basically puff balls.  I don't know how if fix them, but for $40+ they should be a little more professionally made looking.
Cute and the sounds aren't overly obnoxious. Only worried that LO will shove the keys to far back in his mouth that he will choke on them. But otherwise, I love it.

my 5 month old son sleeps on his belly and used to get skin rashes and pimples on his face from drooling. As soon as i switched to this his skin improved and all the pimples gone. Not only that but this pad is super soft! I returned the priva pad, as well as the summer infant because the material was itchy and rough. i know a lot of the reviews say that this pad moves but we don't have that issue and my son loves to move a lot. And....seriously what do you expect? Unless it was tied down, taped, or glued to something you would expect that it might happen even though it has flaps. If you sleep under a blanket that is tucked under the mattress you'd expect the same result. common sense! i highly recommend esp if you are looking for something soft. I can't give a review on how this product hold up after several washes.

I had high hopes for this item based on other reviews, but it was a huge letdown.  It plays one tune with different instruments, and it is too loud for a baby.  With a music background, I really want to expose my son to beautiful, classical music.  This is not the item to do that with.  I will keep looking for other musical toys with more variety and sophistication.Update:  This is still my least favorite toy, mainly due to the volume.  I wish I could turn it down.  Thanks to a helpful comment, I did manage to play all the tunes and felt fairly silly not reading the directions beforehand.  I sill stick with my original rating, though.  There are just so many better toys out there.
wrong pattern they shipped to me and not helping for return back the money! packing very badly! The after sales service extremely a nightmare!
JUST TOOK IT OUT THE DRYER!!!PERFECT WITH THE SIMPLE HUMAN TRASH CAN.I USE IT EVERYDAY AND WOULD HIGHLY RECOMMEND!

We dont use it anymore.  I couldnt' get it to stick to the tub wall.  When it did it would fall... it didn't cover the full tub and i have a standard bathtub.  All in all, not a great use of my money :(  I would not recommend this to anyone.

This pacifier & plush animal have saved us. We discovered this when my baby was 1 month old and it has been incredibly helpful. The lamb helps us hold the pacifier when it would typically fall to the ground when the baby is no longer sucking. It also helps to keep it on my baby's chest as he sleeps and reduces the amount of time it takes his to fall asleep. It is easy to wash in soapy warm water and we will be buying another! This is highly recommended.
My son loves this sippy cup.I love the fact that it keeps juice cool for a very long time and that it handle being tossed around from time to time

For the $15(ish) price, I'd say that this bottle warmer works well.  I mix all the bottles in the morning, put them in the refrigerator and use this to heat up the formula so that it is not freezing cold.  I don't know how accurate the water-lines are because after experimenting with various amounts of water I don't think we've actually had a "warm" bottle yet - rather its just not cold - which I am completely fine with because I don't particularly want my baby becoming accustom to warm bottles when we are out or in the middle of the night.  I would purchase this product again, however, if your baby needs a warm bottle I'd say you probably need a better/more expensive machine.

Both my girls loved these. Both  liked to keep them in their mouths while they crawled around - and that seemed safe because the toothbrushes are so very bendy. But the bristles seem to ease teething pain. They're easy to grab, I guess, and fun to chew on.
summary: Not sure what the magic is, but ...

reviewText: Oh my goodness.... these are the best thing ever! If I had to make the decision again, I would choose Tommee Tippee bottles just so I could use this product. I love that these fit in the bottle with the water already allotted. We have used these with the TT 5 ounce bottles as well as the 9 ounce ones. I havent tried to fill these dispensers with over 8 ounces of formula, but Im glad to read the reviews of others who have and say that it works. If your infant is mostly formula fed, you really need these containers.

My grandson loved this little Winnie the Pooh. It is perfect for hanging on his stroller and the fact that it lights up and plays music keeps him interested and entertained.  It has a nice soft finish, too.
This works well, but I accidentally put in on a little tight so I have the door in for it to lock. I was surprised that my oven even had a gap in the sheet metal that this fits nicely in.
summary: I was surprised that my oven even had a gap in the sheet metal that this fits nicely in.

reviewText: takes me twice as long to get the same amount of milk I was getting from my Medela shields. I went back to work 8 weeks ago and starting pumping 3 times a day. I bought these when I came across a flyer in something else that I had purchased. I figured since I'd be spending so much time pumping that I might as well be comfortable.Whilst pumping I got a text from my sister in law saying that she was getting more milk when she switched back to her Medela shields. I tried going back and she was totally right!I guess I'll keep these around for an extra set, maybe for using on the weekend when I have more time to pump and am not restricted to a 15 minute window.

im happy with this purchase my daughter doesn't like to be cold or hates anything cold touching her skin. i bought this before she was born but she came earlier than we expected and the shipment didn't reach our country yet but its a good thing we purchased it before because we really needed it when she came but i wish i purchased the travel warmer as well but i had already purchased a travel holder before but she's fine for on the go but at home i could only use this to change her. some reviews said the wipes browned r would lose moisture or smelled coming down to the last wipe well i have none of those problems i use the moisture pad that come with it and i re wet it like they say to do every wk and it works great. must have especially for colder countries.

My daughter (just turned 1) absolutely loves this toy.  Each stackable object does its own thing (swivels, squirts etc), and there are so many combinations for her to make.  We've tried several little bath toys designed for kids her age, and this is by far our favorite.  (Alex Tub Drums and Flutes are great runners-up).  My only complaint is that now she never wants to get out of the tub!

Really, it's quite simple.  Put it under your baby's crib sheet to elevate his/her head if he/she has a cough.  I do notice it helps quite a bit.  Combined with a little Baby Vicks on the feet, and the cough is well controlled!
summary: Does what it needs to do

reviewText: My double electric pump will get the job done when I go back to work full-time, but right now I am pumping once a day at home to build up my reserves or when I am out and away from baby. I like this because it's light and travels well and I just don't like pumping both breasts at the same time unless I have to. This pump comes apart for easy cleaning and I especially like not having to deal with tubing. Also, because it's so simple, I can set it down for a moment and not fear that I will spill the milk. I haven't tried other manual pumps so I don't know if it's the best but I am very happy with it. It serves its purpose and fulfills my needs.I've only had this pump for about 3 weeks, but so far so good.
summary: Great for once a day pumping

reviewText: At first my baby didn't pay too much attention to this, and I thought, "great, another thing she won't use!"  But after a few weeks, she can't get enough of it!  The way it's shaped somehow seems to be much more to her liking than the other three teethers we got her.  And it's easier for her to hold.  Great item!

I love this diaper. It was small enough to fit my son right home from the hospital at 7 1/2 pounds and it still fits him at 10 pounds. It is sooo soft and cute! I also rated it higher than other all in one newborn diapers because it dries quickly in one cycle, as opposed to the others than need a dryer cycle and some time in the sun. Also, no staining thus far! *two thumbs up!*
I love it! Has been served us for 8 months already! Its very convinient and safe! GET THIS ONE! All the swing ones are SO lame!

I bought these before my daughter was born because they seemed so inexpensive and I felt like I wanted to be prepared.  They actually fit great in the outlets we have (home built in 2006) and don't come out easily.  However, they are easy for me to remove, which makes it easy for vacuuming or charging a phone.  My daughter is now 10 months old and we have them pretty much everywhere in the house where she roams.  She hasn't tried to pull them out (I can't say the same for the nightlights we have, though; and, to be fair, she has not actually removed those either).  They really don't interest her at all but I feel safer having something blocking her from sticking her finger into the outlet.I actually plan to purchase a second package of these particular plugs since I've used up my first.  I will update this review if she does manage to pull them out in the future.  But for now, they really do serve their purpose.  I wasn't going to write a review except that there are so many negative reviews for this product and I wanted to present a satisfied view.  The plugs go in easily, fit securely, yet are easy enough for an adult to remove when needed.  They certainly protect you from sticking your finger into the outlet (which was my goal).  On a purely esthetic level, I find them rather clean looking as well.  (I will put up a picture as well.)
summary: I actually like these but my baby has never tried to pull them out

reviewText: Not one of my favorite purchases.  It works, but not as well as I would like.  I guess you get what you pay for.  You can hear baby, but usually not until he makes a pretty loud noise or cry.  I like a monitor that lets you hear their breathing sounds (call it being a paranoid mama, but I do...)  It's not an awful monitor, does the job, but not if you're like me and want to be able to hear all the sounds.
summary: Does not pick up baby sounds very well

reviewText: My husband was tired of kids toys cluttering his office.  We put two of these stacked on top and we have room for books and stuffed animals and toys.  Spacious and fits a lot of toys inside.  Love it. Night and day difference!

reviewerName: Ohh Mama "I'm trying to help you."
reviewText: I agree with reviews that say having items that give statistics are better. I use a program on my phone called "Baby ESP" that I love. I thought I was going to like this more because it wasn't tied to my phone and it would be more accessible to others watching my baby (our parents, caregivers..). This isn't true because we can't track what they did. How many diapers were changed. How many pee? How many poo? ... How long was he sleeping? .. All this would do is flash red if it went over a particular time limit. It would tell you how long since the last diaper change, feeding, or nap. No differentiation between breastfeeding or formula feeding.As a new mom, I didn't think the how many and how often were important so much as the crying stopped. However, after my first few doctor visits, I learned that you need a chart indicating accurate numbers to make sure your baby is healthy. They can't tell you how you're feeling so you have to pay attention to every detail available to you.However, the devise does what it was made to do, and it does that well. I don't think it's necessary.

I just love this tub!I got it over a year ago and I take it everywhere! It fits perfectly in the suitcase, is light weight, easy to inflate and use, atractive for the baby, and very, very, very practical! If you plan to travel a lot, or move arround, this is the tub for your baby! Very nice buy, worth it! It was a very good investment!
These are cute and will serve the purpose. But they are very thin, I doubt they will absorb much when used. But as nasty as burp rags tend to get they will be fine for a short time I am sure.

I put these on the corners of our dining room table and they kept my son's head bump free for quite awhile.  And then he got a little older, noticed they were there, and peeled them off.  Oh well.  By then he had learned how to duck.
summary: worked well until my toddler noticed them

reviewText: We bough this railing for our youngest son (age 2) when he moved from a crib to his big boy mid-high loft.  We thought/hoped he'd use the trundle, but he wanted to be in a bed like his older brother.  It is incredibly sturdy and covers almost the entire length of his bed.  That's good because I was honestly envisioning ways to "cage" him in his bed so he wouldn't fall (or escape...think Curious George and you have our little man).  It was simple to assemble and install (I'm naturally blonde and did it myself in 20 minutes, so it can't be that tough), and it is remarkably easy to clean and still looks like new after a year.  Our son has stood against it and leaned on it, but it still holds firm, keeps its shape, and prevents him from falling.  The straps were much easier to adjust and the railing is MUCH MUCH sturdier than our other son's railing (Dex Products), something that stopped us from using them on his brother's bed.  We feel confident that our son is sleeping securely and have never worried about him falling off, even though I was against him sleeping on the mid-high loft.  Buy this railing and you and your child will sleep safe and sound, too!
summary: Serves our purposes, we LOVE the extra long rail!

reviewText: These spoons are a great concept!  LOVE the colors!  That's the end of my positives.Negatives? The bendable part of the spoons bends too much, which makes it kinda worthless after the first couple bites.  And the fork is not effective for poking things at all.  It's more like a spoon with a couple awkward slots on it.If your kid is a righty, we prefer the Sassy Less Mess Toddler Feeding Spoon.  We haven't found a good Lefty option yet, though!

What a God-send this product is!  I did  not even know that this product exists.  We all worry about the little ones, and any product that can help us alleviate any fear is priceless. It features Vibration stimulation after 15 seconds of no movement from the child. When that happens there is an audible alarm after 20 seconds of no movement  There is a movement-rate Indicator that  warns about weak or infrequent movement.  It is small and it  it fits onto baby’s diaper,  Another plus is that it is portableThe fact that it is wireless if really appreciated due to the problems with the corded ones some people have experienced.There are optional Movement Alerts.  It can  be set to detect weak and irregular movements.  When the baby's  abdominal movement  occurs less than 8 times per minute the  light flashes orange and a different warning tone will sound. By default this is enabled but it can be disabledMy only concern at all is having a kind of electrical device close to a baby.  As time goes on we learn more and more about Electrical Magnetic fields and the physical body, and for such a small person, is this really safe?

I guess I was expecting something that looked a little different and was more substantial when this arrived based on the picture but it is okay. I like that it is a compact shade (see uploaded pic) that is the size of a frisbee and that the mesh is tighter than our mosquito net. While our mosquito net did a pretty good job when we used it, this appears that it will do much better. The sunshade part just pulls out of the red bag and snaps into place (see uploaded pic) while the stock photo makes it appear to be more permanent.One thing worth mentioning is that I find it just too much trouble for daily driving. I just toss a blanket over the carrier. I took him out to a Farmer's Market (in Indiana) for less than an hour and his back was soaked. I don't know if that is because of the carrier (have read similar complaints) or because this traps heat in. Our ideal uses for this are for when we will be outside with him for an extended period of time, going for a walk, or long car rides. We haven't used it to keep hands off of the baby because we haven't had the need to. We first took him to church at 3 weeks and we have had a lot of lookers but no one demanding to touch or that touches without asking. It would probably be good for that purpose for premies and babies born closer to winter, though.Very happy that it takes all of 5 second to pull out of the bag and form, about 10 more seconds to secure around the carrier, and about 5 more seconds to collapse and put back in the bag. Like other reviewers that I have seen, I will mention that on mine there is a small gap near the handle of the carrier where bugs could get in (because there is not a gap in the plastic between the handle and the carrier for the shade to slide into) but it is not a deal-breaker for me. Our carrier is a Chicco. Also, like others have said, I do not really like that the sides are completely unprotected from the sun. We travel directly west up to 10 hours (leaving in the morning) and back most of the times that we do travel. Therefore, we will have to use a towel or something to block the sun on the sides since the sun is on the driver's side for the majority of the time during our trips.That said, I couldn't find a back window shade with adequate reviews and am not a fan of the static cling side window shades in my car now that don't stay affixed to the window and make me always have to look twice before changing lanes (in a very busy traffic area) since I am not sure if what I see in my peripheral vision and in back side window is a vehicle distorted by a sun shade or a dark sun shade. I can't forsee this issue with my current shades being any better in the winter. Therefore, this was the perfect option for us so we can ditch the crappy static cling shades we have now. With a few small changes mentioned above, I think this could overtake the entire sunshade market. I am obviously not the only person who dislikes the current options of vehicle sunshade options.
summary: Not covered on the sides from sun but still the best thing on the market

reviewText: I thought this was useful until I discovered the BabyConnect app for iphone.  That is much more versatile and lets me keep track of only one device (my phone).
Cute simple crown. Came fast and looks just like in pictures. Was perfect for my mom to be for the baby shower i was throwing.
Baby seems to like it. I put it in the fridge so it gets nice and cold and he gnaws on it! Can't go wrong. Inexpensive, great teether.
I gave this a bad rating because these should come with your gate, you will need them for any newer house with regular size hallways and doors.
summary: keeps adding cost to your gate

reviewText: I wanted some bibs that were inexpensive, but not cheap quality. These are exactly that! We go through so many bibs, I didn't want to spend too much, but they also last with the frequent washing.

This is a nice baby carrier, but it's very difficult to adjust to size. My Husband is 6'6" and has very broad shoulders and switching from him to me is really difficult. We ended up getting the Baby Bjorn because it's easier to wear.
summary: Difficult to adjust - but it does the job

reviewText: My daughter is 10 months old now and still loves these little birdies (shes had them since she was born).  I thought she would have grown out of them by now, but she loves to chew on them, shake them, and play with them while in the car or stroller.  The patterns are adorable and very easy to wash when dirty by throwing them in the washing machine.  They have yet to fray or fall apart.

These tweezers are a far more useful tool than those disgusting snot suction things! You have to be quick and precise with these but they do the trick. The tips are small enough to fit into a newborn's nose and blunt enough that if you do touch skin or nose it doesn't hurt. The tweezer is the length of a normal tweezer so it fits nicely in my hand. It is easy to clean and you don't need any filters or hoses. The only downside is I could imagine the tip breaking off if I dropped it enough times since it's plastic. On the other hand, you wouldn't want metal in the baby's nose anyway.
summary: Useful to have for your baby.

reviewText: These are very cute and soft blankets.  They're large enough to swaddle your child when they're newborns and make great little blankets for kids to "snuggle" with (think Linus from Peanuts).The only drawback is that they lost the nice sharp look on the patterns after only the first wash.  The fabric began to "pill" and get fuzzy, which made the blankets begin looking shoddy when they were still practically brand new.

Update: Changed my rating from a four to a two. My baby just outgrew these at a measly 12 lbs. By that I mean that I cannot snappi them using the jelly roll fold anymore--they are shrinking with every wash, so I would have to trifold them and lay them in the cover, which isn't ideal because my baby is still quite young and exclusively breastfed. This means I'd have poop exploding everywhere, and I cannot keep changing covers constantly. I'd say just go for cheap but durable SIZED prefolds from cottonbabies, diaper-rite or green mountain diapers. These covers are still great, though, even for smaller babies, so spring for some used ones.Ignore everything the tag says and wash these at least 10 times (with regular laundry, if you want to save water) before using and they are the SOFTEST prefolds. They do NOT fit newborns, however, since they are ridiculously large. I started using them comfortably after my skinny kid hit 9lbs. There is still a lot of bulk/folding down in the front/back. The covers are of extremely cheap quality, but they do the job. Double leg gussets would have helped, but they keep clothes dry, so that's all I care about. I bought four of these trial packs, as another reviewer suggested, and they are serving me well.

I saw this item online and thought it was nice and at a very good price, so I went ahead and bought it. When I received it I was a little disappointed, on 2 things because I never assembled it completely or put my son inside it. The seat had no padding, and the paint on the toys looks like it could come off with any little scratch or rub. The thing that made me want to return it was the seat, there is ABSOLUTELY NO PADDING. Keep in mind, your baby will be rubbing his chest and sides on this. It was hard and I didn't want to imagine how painful that could be for my baby, so I returned it. If money is the issue, you can always look for a used jumperoo, believe me they are really worth it.
summary: Not enough cusion on seat, toys look very cheap

reviewText: When it comes to baby carrying you'll want to get the most durable and comfortable product available since you'll want it to grow with your baby. It's also super important that both parent and baby are comfortable for more than 15 minutes otherwise you won't be carrying your baby in the carrier much.Because of these factors I spent a lot of time testing and researching baby carriers. This one is definitely not a contender. It looks cool and is affordable and lightweight, but just doesn't offer the support you'll need for yourself and baby to use long term. I ended up getting the Moby Wrap, the Infantino Tie Sash, the Baby Bjorn and the Ergo Baby. Out of these, the Ergo Baby is my all time favorite.If you want a more comprehensive review, check out the baby carrier shopping guide on the website AllMomsArePerfect.com. Just look under baby gear essentials and you'll find a full baby registry suggestion list (what you really need versus what you don't), a stroller shopping guide, and even what to expect postpartum, in the delivery room, and how to sleep train your child.
summary: Great price and works well for short trips but I'd recommend spending more for better support

reviewText: I have a very good sleeper and I believe it is thanks to the rock n' play! My daughter has been sleeping through the night since she was a month old and all of my friends with kids are jealous.  I definitely consider this to be a must-have item for a newborn!  Skip the bassinet and get a Rock N' Play.Note: Others have commented that it is difficult to transition a baby from the Rock N' Play to a crib.  I found that this can be true because the Rock N' Play is so cozy and seems to help reduce the startle reflex.  What worked for us was to wrap her up in a Summer Infant Swaddleme blanket (the one with Velcro) after she was sleeping (she doesn't like to be swaddled while she's awake anymore) and then place her in the crib.  Once we started doing that she slept soundly all night in her crib.
summary: Baby sleeps so comfortably in this!

reviewText: ERGObaby came highly recommended. I researched their line and chose the performance carrier as reviews claimed it was breathable and great for hot, sweaty situations. As I was planning a tropical vacation I thought it'd be perfect. My seven month old fits snugly in it. As I mentioned, it is functional. It's easy to get baby in and out. My other carrier requires a masters degree, and can only fit my husband. This one fits us both, and can be put on in a jiffy, with no assistance. Putting it on with baby on the back is tricky, but can be done. The problem I have is my baby can't see over the straps. Maybe it's meant for bigger babies, but my poor child could only rest her head on my chest as her attempts to look over the strap were nearly futile. The regular carrier appears, from, pictures,mot give baby freedom to look around. This one does not.
summary: Functional, but no fun for baby

reviewText: I have now been cloth diapering for a year and I plan to continue with baby number 2 who is one the way. I have only had to strip the diapers once in 8 months and I wash them in Tide Original Detergent. I have never had them leak, although daycare has had a few leaks b/c they don't always look to make sure the absorbent part is tucked in in the back. Cute patterns and very well made diapers. My son was able to fit into the one size at 3 months and we are only on the second set of snaps at 1 year.

I bought these because we liked the newborn covers-- the fit was just right for our little 6-lb baby girl over newborn prefolds and kissaluv newborn fitted diapers.  However these one-size covers fit my now 10lb baby very poorly. When I fold down to the smallest or medium size, the garter around the leg holes gets really bulky.  No leaks though.  Even at a larger setting there are garter marks around her thighs and she has quite skinny legs.  The thirsties x-small and duo wrap covers and the blueberry coveralls fit her much better.  Maybe when she gets bigger, when we won't have to fold the rise down so much, these will fit better.  These are my least favorite covers and I honestly regret this purchase.

It sounds gross at first, but it works so nicely. You get good suction using your own body, and because it's not electric you don't have to worry about sucking TOO much. When you need to breathe, your baby can breathe. Works good for anything in the nose, including spit up or vomit.

I am so surprised that during the first and second wash, it piles badly, there are loose 'cotton balls' on the swaddle, and they fly all over the place in my laundry yard. I used a lint roller to manually remove the lint to wash a 3rd time and it is still piling, though not so bad anymore. I'snt it supposed to be pre-washed? I also noticed a chemical smell when it came in a box, it is also not as soft as I would expect it to be.This is an expensive item, for this price point, i expect much better quality.

i can't say that it "worked" or didn't but i can say that my daughter never had a bad teething issue (other than drool) and she wore this every day from 1 month old until 2 years. it is so cute and we get many compliments on it. it has become one of my favorite keepsakes from my daughter (i'll get my second kid her/his own) and i was heartbroken when i thought i lost it.

This is exactly what I've been looking for. I live in Hawaii and love to take my son outdoors, but the shades on my strollers were just inadequate! I recently purchased a jogging stroller (InStep, which I also love) and have a Combi Travel System. Both have a very small shade, especially the combi. This attachment is great! It is very easy to attach to your stroller and works fantastic. You can leave it on and just fold back your stroller's shade as normal. Its adjustable, to give just an extra couple inches or more than a foot of shade. I highly recommend it.

We just started using these with our 10 month old and so far we love them. We help him spear food with the spork and he's learning how to put it in his mouth. These are really cute and easy to clean. My son loves to chew on them so I foresee us having io buy a second set in the future.
summary: Great for beginners and super cute!

reviewText: These are simple but fantastic. My son has been enjoying them since he was 3 months old and they are hands down one of his favorite toys. I keep them by the bath and he always looks forward to playing with him, he also likes the sound of hitting them together. Sometimes the most simple things are the best in life...
I have tried numerous baby spoons.  I like these the best.  They are soft, pliable and easy to use.  Also, dishwasher safe, which is a must in my house.

These are fantastic. We've tried 5 kinds/brands of bottles including very expensive born free and other high ends- and dr browns was the best. We noticed an obvious difference after one feeding. He used to burp alot with the other bottles, have gas, etc- he burped ONCE with dr browns and fell asleep. This still happens 9 months later. Yes, it's a pain to clean all the parts- but what we do is rinse with hot water then we use a little bottle parts "cage" for the little bits and wash them in the dishwasher, top shelf. Nothing is ever nasty, goey, or discolored like the other reviewers claimed. I've literally never had an issue. We use the 8 oz bottles (glass) exclusively now. I don't recommend the plastic- they leak terribly.These are great. We've never looked back.
summary: Solved all baby's gas problems, and reduced our stress load.

reviewText: I love this pillow. I also have a Boppy, which doesn't work well for nursing. The Boppy is rounded in the middle and isn't very tight (or adjustable), so the baby rolls into me - not helpful when I'm trying to keep him close. Especially early on when most moms are very sore, you don't want the baby to move around too much once he's latched on. It is adjustable with velcro, which is very loud, so don't do it when your baby is right there if he's sensitive to noise. Once the velcro is in the right place, there's a plastic clip so you can get it on and off easily. The only complaint I have is that I had to buy a new cover because the old one shrank after I washed it. I dried it partway (still quite damp) and then hung it up, but it shrank so much that I had to buy a new one. Even with a cover that fits, it's a total pain to get it back on. But other than that, it's a great pillow.
summary: Love this (but beware the cover shrinking)

reviewText: I tried Ergo, Moby, and Baby K'tan. My baby is three month old and this one works the best. It used to take at least 30 minutes to put my baby to sleep. As soon as she yawns, I put her in Baby K'tan and it takes just 10 mins for her to fall asleep or when she is fussier, I'll say 30 minutes the most. When my baby is overtired, I just let her sleep in the sleep over an hour while I do easy house chores or sit on a glide and read. When I take her outside, I carry her facing outward so she can see people and objects. She loves it.Like some other reviewers said, it is similar to Moby but it is so much easier to use (no hassle wrapping around the fabric esp when the fussy baby wants you badly) and not as hot as it's got less fabric. It feels a little too tight but it stretches as I wear it and shrinks back when I wash it. The sizing worked pretty well too.My only wish is that Baby K'tan comes with more fashionable colors and designs(I got ivory), and not as pricy.

I have the munchkin spoons too, which are great, (its a spoon lol) but the issue i have is they are too long. I would drop them out of the gerber or earths best jar all the time.These spoons are perfect because the handle isnt crazy long, and it can sit in the jar of food or the food bowl without falling on the floor or flipping up and making a babyfood mess on you!

Out of all diapers Ive tried I recommend bum genius as the best.  Size will last till toddler age.  diaper cover fully covers bum area.  Inner lining stays relatively dry.  I especially like the two sizes of inserts.  One very small, thin insert for tiny babies and larger insert when needed.  The smaller insert can later be used to double up w/ larger insert for naps.
These are great spoons they just wear out quick and are really easy to melt. I get them cause they are cheap and easy to to travel with.
While we love the original woombie, this woombie swaddler is WAY too tight for our baby who is 8 pounds.
You get what you pay for! Baby hates these. They are so hard and too short under the lip so baby can't even auck properly on these. Soothies are the way to go!

Honestly, this stroller was ok at first, but quickly wore out.  It handles terribly over any terrain that isn't perfectly flat, and if you change direction too quickly, the front wheels do not swivel and you can't push the stroller forward at all until you manually turn the wheels by hand (or foot).  It drives me crazy!  However, it gets 3 stars (and not 2) because the storage compartment is AMAZING.  Also, for the price it was better than I expected.  Still, you get what you pay for.

Pros:- deep recline- Stands upright when folded. useful when parking at school.- canopy does not touch wheels when folded.- easy to fold with one hand while holding baby- light weight about 13 pds- good head room for taller toddlers- easy to use buckleCons:- expensive- it is a pain to lock front wheels every time you fold it so that it stands properly- small basket- handles are not adjustable- handles are cheap hard plastic. not ergonomic and uncomfortable.  they need better handles for this price!- need to adjust the footrest every time you unfold- canopy is hard to adjust down. Wish there was a canopy extension for better coverage when in full recline.- hard to access basket when reclined- no shoulder carry strap- wheels are squeaky/loudI also have the Uppababy G-lite.  I like the fold of the Peg (easier), but besides that there's not much else going for it.The G-lite is better since the wheels do not make so much noise and it has comfortable handles.The basket is also better because you can put bags along the back of the seat.  With the Peg there is a handle in the way (used to close the stroller) so you cannot putanything along the back. The G-lite does not recline but I don't need it for my child.You can get the G-luxe if you need the recline.

While perhaps a little pricey, these products by Planet Wise are certainly worth the money! I used this owl pattern for all my baby stuff (this diaper changing pad, PW wet diaper bag, and then I also made a crib blanket and bobby pillow cover out of the same pattern material). The towel part is super soft. I haven't washed it yet, but I would put it on a gentle wash so as not to loose that softness. In addition to this pad and the small wet diaper bag, I hope to one day purchase the large wet diaper bag as well. I highly recommend Planet Wise and their products especially if you love a specific pattern that their product(s) host.

I was trying to find the best monitor I could find without spending a fortune. This was one of my greatest baby buys! It sounds crystal clear; you can hear everything you would want to hear as a new mommy. Easy to assemble and use right away. The small loop handle on the monitor lights up, it is a neat feature. The best feature of the monitor is the walkie-talkie feature. I can actually talk to my baby using the TALK feature on the monitor to still stay connected to baby even though I'm not in the room with him. You can hear baby and he/she can hear you. There is nothing more you can ask for. AN AWESOME BUY, HIGHLY HIGHLY RECOMMENDED! EXTREMELY AFFORDABLE FOR THE HIGH QUALITY YOU WILL RECEIVE.

I've had a few Belkin audio products and all of them have broken within a month or two at most. I tried this with high hopes that their video division is another animal entirely.Well, it might be, but that animal is at present wounded and lying under a tree wondering when the software folks are going to get their um stuff together.Like most everyone else here, the app for this ain't working for us. Freezes, goes buggy, or just won't even connect. And when wifi connectivity is the basic premise of your product, that spells one star.Belkin is doing a great job at making a bad name for themselves. I guess they sell their stuff semi-cheap at MallWart for a reason.
summary: Typical Belkin quality: it doesn't work
